info.name: DashLab API Sample
info.description:
Sample API requsts for DashLab. **There is no users or authentication**

# NOTE
- Since `Post` stores `Social Media Account`, you will have to create the social media account firsts. There should be a some sample request you can make.

-  Anything after a colon means it is a variable used by Postman

variable.description: The id used by Django. If no id is provided, it will get everything

request.description:
This request will get the Posts stored. A `GET` requires you to provide the objects `id` as a parameter in the URL. It will return the following as a JSON object

| Key          	| Meaning                                                                                 	| AutoGenerated 	|
|--------------	|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------	|---------------	|
| id           	| The internal id used by Django. This is an `int`                                        	| True          	|
| text_content 	| This is the text that will be posted to social media                                    	| False         	|
| created_at   	| Returns the date and time of when the post is created as a `string` in ISO 8601 format. 	| True          	|
| account      	| An array of `int` which store the Social Media account `id`'s                           	| False         	|

This request will create a new Post and upload to the server. A `POST` requires you to provide the objects a JSON object in the body. The valid keys and their meaning can be found in `GET` documentation

# NOTE
- `POST` request does **NOT** require the autogenerated key(s):
This request will delete a Post given its `id`.  A `DELETE` requires you to provide the objects `id` as a parameter in the URL You can obtain the `id` using a `GET` request

This request will let you update a Post and upload the changes to the server. A `PATCH` requires you to provide the objects `id` as a parameter in the URL and a JSON object in the body. The valid keys and their meaning can be found in `GET` documentation

# NOTE 
- you don't have to include all the parameters in the body, just the parameter you want to modify
- You must **NOT** modify auto generated keys

item.name: Social Media Account

variable.description: The id used by Django. If no id is provided, it will get everything

request.description:
This request will get the Social Media Accounts stored. A `GET` requires you to provide the objects `id` as a parameter in the URL. It will return the following as a JSON object | Key | Meaning | Auto Generated | |------------ |------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |--------------- | | id | The internal id used by Django. This is an `int` | True | | name | The name of the account | False | | platform | The social media platform that the account belongs to. They can only be following values:
  • `facebook`
  • `twitter`
| False | | created_at | Returns the date and time of when the post is created as a `string` in ISO 8601 format. | True |

This request will create a new Social Media Accounts and upload to the server. A `POST` requires you to provide a JSON object in the body. The valid keys and their meaning can be found in `GET` documentation

# NOTE
- `POST` request does **NOT** require the autogenerated key(s):
This request will delete a Social Media Accounts given its `id`.  A `DELETE` requires you to provide the objects `id` as a parameter in the URL You can obtain the `id` using a `GET` request

This request will let you update a Social Media Account and upload the changes to the server. A `PATCH` requires you to provide the objects `id` as a parameter in the URL and a JSON object in the body. The valid keys and their meaning can be found in `GET` documentation

# NOTE 
- you don't have to include all the parameters in the body, just the parameter you want to modify
- You must **NOT** modify auto generated keys

item.description: Sample API requests for interacting with Social Media Accounts
